sentences.text: ब्रह्मा रुद्रः कुमारो हरिवरुणयमा वह्निरिद्रः कुबेरः चन्द्रादित्यौ सरस्वत्यदधियुगनगा वायुरुर्वीभुजङ्गाः।

metadata.translit: brahmā rudraḥ kumāro harivaruṇayamā vahniridraḥ kuberaḥ candrādityau sarasvatyadadhiyuganagā vāyururvībhujaṅgāḥ .
metadata.text_fr: J’en appelle à Brahmā, créateur du monde, À Rudra, destructeur du monde, À Kumāra, premier fils de Shiva, dieu de la guerre, À Hari, protecteur du monde, À Varuṇa, dieu des océans, À Yamā, dieu de la mort, À Vahni, dieu du feu, À Indra, roi des dieux, maître du ciel, À Kubera, dieu des richesses de la terre ; J’en appelle à Chandra, la lune, et à Aditya, le soleil, À Sarasvatī, déesse de la sagesse, de la parole sacrée et de la science, Aux océans, Aux âges du monde, yuga, À la montagne, nagā, Au vent, vayu, À la terre, urvi, Et aux serpents, bhujanga ;

sentences.text: सिढा नद्यो श्विनौ श्रीर् दितिर् अदितिसुता मातरश् चंडिकाद्या वेदास्तीर्थानि यक्षा गणवसुमुनयः पन्तु नित्यं ग्रहाश्च॥

metadata.translit: siḍhā nadyo śvinau śrīr ditir aditisutā mātaraś caṁḍikādyā vedāstīrthāni yakṣā gaṇavasumunayaḥ pantu nityaṁ grahāśca :
metadata.text_fr: J’en appelle aux hommes accomplis, siddha, Aux rivières, Aux jumeaux célestes émissaires de l’aurore, Aśvini, À la déesse Sri, la suprême, À Diti, la déesse sombre, mère des titans, Aux enfants de la déesse Aditi, À toutes les mères, À Chaṇḍikā, la déesse farouche, et à toutes les autres ! J’en appelle aux védas, Aux lieux saints de pèlerinages, tirtha, Aux génies sylvestres, yaksa, Aux divinités mineures de la troupe de Shiva, gaṇa, Aux assistants d’Indra, vasu, Aux sages, à vous, qui faites vœu de silence, Et à vous, les astres, Vous tous, protégéez-nous !

J’en appelle aux sages érudits, À Manou, l’auteur de Manu-smriti, traité sur la gouvernance, À Vācaspati, auteur d’un traité de conduite, maître des prières, À Shukra, le scintillant Vénus, Au sage Parāśara, père de Vyāsa et des hymnes du rig-veda, À Sasuta, Vyasayukta…
Et à Canakya, ministre de Chandra Gupta Maurya, À tous les savants, Auteurs du traité du Naya-shastra, traité qui rend compte de la réalité multiforme, Vous tous, protégéez-nous !

sentences.text: सकलार्थशास्त्रसारं जगति समालोक्य विष्णुशर्मेदम्। तन्त्रैः पञ्चभिः एतत् चकार सुमनोहरं शास्त्रम् ॥

metadata.translit: sakalārthaśāstrasāraṁ jagati samālokya viṣṇuśarmedam. tantraiḥ pañcabhiḥ etat cakāra sumanoharaṁ śāstram :
metadata.wtext: सकलार्थशास्त्रसारं जगति समालोक्य विष्णुशर्मेदम्। तन्त्रैः पञ्चभिरैतच्चकार सुममोहरं शास्त्रम् ॥
metadata.wtranslit: sakalārthaśāstrasāraṁ jagati samālokya viṣṇuśarmedam. tantraiḥ pañcabhiraitaccakāra sumamoharaṁ śāstram :
metadata.text_fr: Après avoir étudié et ressenti la quintessence du traité de l’Artha-shastra dans ce monde, Vishnu Sharma créa cette œuvre divisée en cinq livres, un traité très ludique.
metadata.ryder: One Vishnusharman, shrewdly gleaning / All worldly wisdom's inner meaning, / In these five books the charm compresses / Of all such books the world possesses.

metadata.wtext: तद्यथाऽनुश्रूयते।
metadata.wtranslit: tadyathā’nuśrūyate.
metadata.text_fr: Voilà ce qui nous est parvenu par la tradition orale.
metadata.text_en: This is what is heard.
metadata.ryder: And this is how it happened.

sentences.text: अस्ति दाक्षिणात्ये जनपदे महिलारोप्यं नाम नगरम्।

metadata.translit: asti dākṣiṇātye janapade mahilāropyaṁ nāma nagaram.
metadata.text_fr: Il y avait, dans une contrée méridionale, une contrée peuplée, une ville du nom de Mahilaropya.
metadata.text_en: There is a city called Mahilaropya in the southern country.
metadata.ryder: In the southern country is a city called Maidens' Delight.

metadata.ptext: tatra sakala arTa SAstra viSAradaH pravara nfpa mukuwa maRi marIci caya carcita caraRaH sakala kalA pAram gataH a mara SaktiH nAma rAjA baBUva
metadata.wtext: तत्र सकलार्थिसार्थकल्पद्रुमः प्रवरमुकुटमणिमरीचिमञ्जरीचर्चितचरणयुगलः सकलकलापारङ्गतेऽमरशक्तिर्नाम राजा बभूव।
metadata.wtranslit: tatra sakalārthisārthakalpadrumaḥ pravaramukuṭamaṇimarīcimañjarīcarcitacaraṇayugalaḥ sakalakalāpāraṅgate’maraśaktirnāma rājā babhūva.
metadata.text_fr: Là, vivait un roi nommé Amara-shakti (Force-éternelle), versé dans l’Artha-shastra, traité sur la chose publique. Il était aussi généreux que Kalpa-druma, l’un des cinq arbres du paradis qui exauce les vœux de tous les quémandeurs ! Vénéré de son peuple pour sa grande intelligence, il était d’une aura resplendissante !
metadata.text_en: There lived a king named Amarashakti.
metadata.ryder: There lived a king named Immortal-Power.

sentences.text: तस्य त्रयः पुत्राः परमदुर्मेधसः वसुशक्तिः उग्रशक्तिः अनन्तशक्तिश् चेति बभूवुः।

metadata.translit: tasya trayaḥ putrāḥ paramadurmedhasaḥ vasuśaktiḥ ugraśaktiḥ anantaśaktiś ceti babhūvuḥ.
metadata.wtext: तस्य त्रयः पुत्राः परमदुर्मेधसो वहुशक्तिरुग्रशक्तिरनन्तशक्तिश्चेति नामानो बभूवुः।
metadata.wtranslit: tasya trayaḥ putrāḥ paramadurmedhaso vahuśaktirugraśaktiranantaśaktiśceti nāmāno babhūvuḥ.
metadata.text_fr: Mais ses trois fils, Vasu-shakti (Force brillante), Ugra-shakti (Force puissante) et Aneka-shakti (Force multiple), étaient dépourvus de toute lueur d’intelligence.
metadata.ryder: This king had three sons. Their names were Rich-Power, Fierce-Power, Endless-Power, and they were supreme blockheads.

sentences.text: अथ तान् शास्त्रविमुखान् समालोक्य स राजा सचिवान् आहूय प्रोवाच ।

metadata.translit: atha tān śāstravimukhān samālokya sa rājā sacivān āhūya provāca .
metadata.wtext: अथ राजा ताञ्शास्त्रविमुखान् आलोक्य सचिवान् आहूय प्रोवाच ।
metadata.wtranslit: atha rājā tāñśāstravimukhān ālokya sacivān āhūya provāca .
metadata.text_fr: Convoquant ses ministres, le roi leur dit :
metadata.ryder: Now when the king perceived that they were hostile to education, he summoned his counselors and said:

sentences.text: भोः, ज्ञातम् एतद् भवद्भिर्यन्ममैते त्रयोऽपि पुत्राः शास्त्रविमुखा विवेकहीनाश्च।

metadata.translit: bhoḥ, jñātam etad bhavadbhiryanmamaite trayo’pi putrāḥ śāstravimukhā vivekahīnāśca.
metadata.ptext: BoH jYAtam etat BavadBiH yat mama ete putrAH SAstra vimuKAH viveka rahitAH
metadata.text_fr: Messieurs les ministres, mes trois fils que voici sont totalement hermétiques au shastra, et, par-là, dépourvus de tout discernement.
metadata.ryder: Gentlemen, it is known to you that these sons of mine, being hostile to education, are lacking in discernment.

sentences.text: तत् एतान् पश्यतः मे महदपि राज्यम् न सौख्यम् आवहति ।

metadata.translit: tat etān paśyataḥ me mahadapi rājyam na saukhyam āvahati .
metadata.wtext: तदेतान् पश्यतो मे महदपि राज्यं न सौख्यम् आवहति ।
metadata.wtranslit: tadetān paśyato me mahadapi rājyaṁ na saukhyam āvahati .
metadata.text_fr: De ce fait, le royaume ne connaîtra guère de tranquillité !
metadata.text_en: So when I see them, the kingdom, however great, does not bring me happiness.
metadata.ryder: So when I behold them, my kingdom brings me no happiness, though all external thorns are drawn.

metadata.ptext: अथवा साधू इदम् उच्यते
metadata.text_fr: Les sâdhus disent bien :
metadata.text_en: For it is said by the sadhus:
metadata.ryder: For there is wisdom in the proverb:

sentences.text: अजातमृतमूर्खेभ्यो मृताजातौ सुतौ वरम्। यतस्तौ स्वल्पदुःखाय यावज्जीवं जडो दहेत् ॥

metadata.translit: ajātamr̥tamūrkhebhyo mr̥tājātau sutau varam. yatastau svalpaduḥkhāya yāvajjīvaṁ jaḍo dahet :
metadata.ptext: a jAta mfta mUrKeByaH mfta a jAtO sutO varam yataH tO svalpa duHKAya yAvat jIvam jaqaH dahet
metadata.text_fr: À choisir entre non né, mort ou idiot, mieux vaut un fils mort-né car la douleur est courte. Un fils idiot, lui, fait souffrir toute la vie !
metadata.text_en: Of unborn, dead or fools, dead and unborn sons are better. For they cause a little pain whereas an idiot destroys the whole life.
metadata.ryder: Of sons unborn, or dead, or fools, / Unborn or dead will do: / They cause a little grief, no doubt; / But fools, a long life through.

sentences.text: वरं गर्भस्रावो वरमृतुषु नैवाभिगमनं वरं जातः प्रोतो वरमपि च कन्यैव जनिता। वरं वन्ध्या भार्या वरमपि च गर्भेषु वसतिर् न चाविद्वान् रूपद्रविणगुणयुक्तोऽपि तनयः॥

metadata.translit: varaṁ garbhasrāvo varamr̥tuṣu naivābhigamanaṁ varaṁ jātaḥ proto varamapi ca kanyaiva janitā. varaṁ vandhyā bhāryā varamapi ca garbheṣu vasatir na cāvidvān rūpadraviṇaguṇayukto’pi tanayaḥ:
metadata.text_fr: Mieux vaut une fausse couche, Mieux vaut ne pas s’accoupler durant le printemps. Mieux vaut qu’un enfant naisse mort ou meure juste après la naissance. Mieux vaut encore la naissance d’une fille ! Mieux vaut une femme stérile ou que l’enfant ne naisse jamais plutôt qu’un fils beau et vertueux, mais inculte !
metadata.text_en: Better a miscarriage, better not have sex during the fertile period, better a dead birth, better beget a daughter. Better a sterile wife than a son that is unintelligent, even if beautiful, rich and honest.

metadata.ptext: taTA ca
metadata.ryder: And again:

sentences.text: किम् तया क्रियते धेन्वा या न सूते न क्षीरम् ददाति।

metadata.translit: kim tayā kriyate dhenvā yā na sūte na kṣīram dadāti.
metadata.wtext: किं तया क्रियते धेन्वा या न सूते न दुग्धदा।
metadata.wtranslit: kiṁ tayā kriyate dhenvā yā na sūte na dugdhadā.
metadata.text_fr: À quoi bon une vache, qui ne vêle ni ne donne de lait !
metadata.text_en: What to do with a cow which neither calves nor gives milk?
metadata.ryder: To what good purpose can a cow / That brings no calf nor milk, be bent?

sentences.text: कः अर्थः पुत्रेण जातेन यः न विद्वान् न भक्तिमान् अस्ति॥

metadata.translit: kaḥ arthaḥ putreṇa jātena yaḥ na vidvān na bhaktimān asti:
metadata.wtext: कोऽर्थः पुत्रेण जातेन यो न विद्वान्न भक्तिमान्॥
metadata.wtranslit: ko’rthaḥ putreṇa jātena yo na vidvānna bhaktimān:
metadata.text_fr: À quoi bon un fils né, qui n’est ni savant ni dévot !
metadata.text_en: What is the purpose of a son born who is neither intelligent nor obedient?
metadata.ryder: Or why beget a son who proves / A dunce and disobedient?

sentences.text: तदेतेषां यथा बुद्धिप्रबोधनं भवति तथा कोऽप्युपायोऽनुष्ठीयताम्।

metadata.translit: tadeteṣāṁ yathā buddhiprabodhanaṁ bhavati tathā ko’pyupāyo’nuṣṭhīyatām .
metadata.ptext: tat ezAm budDi praboDanam yaTA Bavati taTA kena api upAyena anu sTeyam iti
metadata.text_fr: Alors, pour éveiller leur intelligence, que l’on trouve une solution.
metadata.ryder: Some means must therefore be devised to awaken their intelligence.

sentences.text: अत्र च मद्दत्तां वृत्तिं भुञ्जानानां पण्डितानां पञ्चशती तिष्ठति।

metadata.translit: atra ca maddattāṁ vr̥ttiṁ bhuñjānānāṁ paṇḍitānāṁ pañcaśatī tiṣṭhati.
metadata.text_fr: Or voyons, il y a ici cinq cents pandits qui jouissent de mes faveurs.
metadata.text_en: And there are five hundred sages who enjoy my favor.

sentences.text: ततो यथा मम मनोरथाः सिद्धिं यान्ति तथानुष्ठीयतामिति।

metadata.translit: tato yathā mama manorathāḥ siddhiṁ yānti tathānuṣṭhīyatāmiti.
metadata.text_fr: Aussi, que mes souhaits se réalisent ! Et vite !
metadata.text_en: Thus, let my wish reach its fulfilment, so be it.

metadata.ptext: atra ekEkaSaH pra UcuH
metadata.wtext: तत्रैकः प्रोवाच -
metadata.wtranslit: tatraikaḥ provāca -
metadata.text_fr: Alors l’un d’eux intervint :
metadata.text_en: Then one minister said
metadata.ryder: And they, one after another, replied:

metadata.wtext: 'देव! द्वादशभिर्वर्षैर्व्याकरणं श्रूयते ।
metadata.wtranslit: 'deva! dvādaśabhirvarṣairvyākaraṇaṁ śrūyate .
metadata.text_fr: « Seigneur ! Il faut douze années pour apprendre la grammaire par la tradition orale aux pieds d’un maître ;
metadata.text_en: Your Majesty, one learns grammar in twelve years.
metadata.ryder: "O King, first one learns grammar, in twelve years.

sentences.text: ततो धर्मशास्त्राणि मन्वादीनि अर्थशास्त्राणि चाणक्यादीनि कामशास्त्राणि वात्स्यायनादीनि।

metadata.translit: tato dharmaśāstrāṇi manvādīni arthaśāstrāṇi cāṇakyādīni kāmaśāstrāṇi vātsyāyanādīni.
metadata.text_fr: viennent ensuite l’apprentissage du Dharma-shastra, traité de lois du sage Manou, puis celui de l’Artha-shastra, traité sur la chose publique du sage Chanakya, suivi du Kama-shastra, traité sur l’amour du sage Vatsyayana, et bien d’autres encore.
metadata.text_en: Then Dharmashastra by Manu, Arthashastra by Chanakya, Kamashastra by Vātsyāyana.
metadata.ryder: If this subject has somehow been mastered, then one masters the books on religion and practical life.

metadata.ptext: tat yadi kaTam api jYAyate tataH Darma arTa SAstrARi jYAyante

metadata.wtext: ततः प्रतिबोधनं भवति।'
metadata.wtranslit: tataḥ pratibodhanaṁ bhavati.'
metadata.text_fr: C’est ainsi que se forge la connaissance. »
metadata.ryder: Then the intelligence awakens."

metadata.wtext: अथ तन्मध्यतः सुमतिर्नाम सचिवः प्राह ।
metadata.wtranslit: atha tanmadhyataḥ sumatirnāma sacivaḥ prāha .
metadata.text_fr: Alors, au milieu de tous, le ministre du nom de Sumati, le sage-bienveillant, prit la parole :
metadata.ryder: But one of their number, a counselor named Keen, said:

metadata.text_fr: « La vie n’est pas chose éternelle
metadata.text_en: Life is not eternal.
metadata.ryder: "O King, the duration of life is limited,

metadata.text_fr: et les traités prennent du temps pour être intelligibles.
metadata.text_en: Mastered verbal sciences require time spent.
metadata.ryder: and the verbal sciences require much time for mastery.

sentences.text: तत् सङ्क्षेपमात्रम् शास्त्रम् किंचिद् एतेषाम् प्रबोधनार्थम् चिन्त्यताम्।

metadata.translit: tat saṅkṣepamātram śāstram kiṁcid eteṣām prabodhana artham cintyatām.
metadata.wtext: तत् सङ्क्षेपमात्रं शास्त्रं किञ्चितेतेषां प्रबोधनार्थं चिन्त्यतामिति।
metadata.wtranslit: tat saṅkṣepamātraṁ śāstraṁ kiñciteteṣāṁ prabodhanārthaṁ cintyatāmiti.
metadata.text_fr: Alors pensez plutôt à leur en faire un condensé pour éveiller leur conscience.
metadata.ryder: Therefore let some kind of epitome be devised to wake their intelligence.

metadata.ptext: uktam ca yataH
metadata.text_fr: Ainsi, ne dit-on pas :
metadata.text_en: And it is said
metadata.ryder: There is a proverb that says:

sentences.text: अनन्तपारं किल शब्दशास्त्रम् स्वल्पं तथायुर्वहवश्च विघ्नाः। सारं ततो ग्राह्यमपास्य फल्गु हंसैर्ययथा क्षीरमिवाम्बुमध्यात्॥

metadata.translit: anantapāraṁ kila śabdaśāstram svalpaṁ tathāyurvahavaśca vighnāḥ. sāraṁ tato grāhyamapāsya phalgu haṁsairyayathā kṣīramivāmbumadhyāt :
metadata.ptext: an anta pAram kila Sabda SAstram svalpam taTA AyuH bahavaH ca viGnAH yat sAra BUtam tat upa AsanIyam haMsEH yaTA kzIram iva ambu maDyAt
metadata.text_fr: Sans limites sont les enseignements de la tradition orale. La vie est très courte, et les obstacles nombreux. / Aussi, faut-il en saisir l’essence et non l’apparence, tel le cygne à même de discerner le lait de l’eau.
metadata.text_en: Verbal science does not have limits, life is short, and it brings you obstacles.
metadata.ryder: Since verbal science has no final end, / Since life is short, and obstacles impend, / Let central facts be picked and firmly fixed, / As swans extract the milk with water mixed.

sentences.text: अत्रास्ति विष्णुशर्मा नाम ब्राह्मणः सकलशास्त्रपारङ्गतश्चात्र संसदि लब्धकीर्तिः।

metadata.translit: atrāsti viṣṇuśarmā nāma brāhmaṇaḥ sakalaśāstrapāraṅgataścātra saṁsadi labdhakīrtiḥ.
metadata.wtext: तदत्रास्ति विष्णुशर्मा नाम ब्राह्मणः सकलशास्त्रपारङ्गमः छात्रसंसदि लब्धकीर्तिः।
metadata.wtranslit: tadatrāsti viṣṇuśarmā nāma brāhmaṇaḥ sakalaśāstrapāraṅgamaḥ chātrasaṁsadi labdhakīrtiḥ.
metadata.text_fr: Il y a ici, parmi nous, un brâhmane du nom de Vishnu Sharma, fin connaisseur de tous les traités, plébiscité par ses élèves.
metadata.text_en: There is a Brahman here named Vishnusharma, who learned all sciences and is famous at the court here.
metadata.ryder: Now there is a Brahman here named Vishnusharman, with a reputation for competence in numerous sciences.

metadata.wtext: तस्मै समर्पयतु एतान्।
metadata.wtranslit: tasmai samarpayatu etān.
metadata.text_fr: Confiez-lui les princes !
metadata.text_en: Entrust them to him.
metadata.ryder: Intrust the princes to him.

sentences.text: स नूनं द्राक् प्रबुद्धान् करिष्यति इति।

metadata.translit: sa nūnaṁ drāk prabuddhān kariṣyati iti.
metadata.ptext: sa nUnam drAk pra budDAn karizyati
metadata.text_fr: il les rendra vite intelligents »
metadata.text_en: He will certainly make them intelligent quickly.
metadata.ryder: He will certainly make them intelligent in a twinkling."

sentences.text: सः राजा तत् आकर्ण्य विष्णुशर्माणम् आहूय प्रोवाच ।

metadata.translit: saḥ rājā tat ākarṇya viṣṇuśarmāṇam āhūya provāca .
metadata.wtext: स राजा तदाकर्ण्य विष्णुशर्माणमाहूय प्रोवाच ।
metadata.wtranslit: sa rājā tadākarṇya viṣṇuśarmāṇamāhūya provāca .
metadata.text_fr: Entendant cela, le roi appela Vishnu Sharma et dit :
metadata.text_en: Hearing this, the king summoned Vishnusharma and said:
metadata.ryder: When the king had listened to this, he summoned Vishnusharman and said:

sentences.text: भोः भगवन् मदनुग्रहार्थमेतान् अर्थशास्त्रं प्रति द्राग् यथानंयषड्दर्शनान् विदधासि तथा कुरु।

metadata.translit: bhoḥ bhagavan madanugrahārthametān arthaśāstraṁ prati drāg yathānaṁyaṣaḍdarśanān vidadhāsi tathā kuru.
metadata.ptext: BoH Bagavan mat anu graha arTam etAn kumArAn arTa SAstram prati yaTA ananya sadfSAn vi daDAsi taTA kAryam
metadata.text_fr: « Noble Seigneur ! De grâce, pour moi, enseignez-leur l’Artha-shastra, l’art de la gouvernance !
metadata.ryder: "Holy sir, as a favor to me you must make these princes incomparable masters of the art of practical life.

metadata.wtext: तदाहं त्वां शासनशतेन योजयिष्यामि।
metadata.wtranslit: tadāhaṁ tvāṁ śāsanaśatena yojayiṣyāmi.
metadata.text_fr: Je vous ferai alors chef de cent villages ! »
metadata.ryder: In return, I will bestow upon you a hundred land-grants."

metadata.wtext: अथ विष्णुशर्मा तं राजानमाह
metadata.wtranslit: atha viṣṇuśarmā taṁ rājānamāha
metadata.text_fr: Alors Vishnu Sharma répondit au roi :
metadata.ryder: And Vishnusharman made answer to the king:

metadata.wtext: देव श्रूयतां मे तथ्यवचनम्।
metadata.wtranslit: deva śrūyatāṁ me tathyavacanam.
metadata.text_fr: « Écoutez donc ma parole sincère.
metadata.ryder: "O King, listen. Here is the plain truth.

metadata.wtext: नाहं विद्याविक्रयं शासनशतेनापि करोमि।
metadata.wtranslit: nāhaṁ vidyāvikrayaṁ śāsanaśatenāpi karomi.
metadata.text_fr: Je ne vends pas la connaissance, ni ne souhaite gouverner cent villages.
metadata.ryder: I am not the man to sell good learning for a hundred land-grants.

sentences.text: अहम् तव पुत्रान् मासषट्केन यदि नीतिशास्त्रज्ञानम् न करोमि ततः अहम् स्वनामत्यागम् करोमि।

metadata.translit: aham tava putrān māsaṣaṭkena yadi nītiśāstrajñānam na karomi tataḥ aham svanāmatyāgam karomi.
metadata.wtext: पुनरेतान् तव पुत्रान् मासषट्केन यदि नीतिशास्त्रज्ञान् न करोमि ततः स्वनामत्यागं करोमि।
metadata.wtranslit: punaretān tava putrān māsaṣaṭkena yadi nītiśāstrajñān na karomi tataḥ svanāmatyāgaṁ karomi.
metadata.ptext: etAn punaH mAsa zawkena yadi nIti SAstra jYAn na karomi tataH sva nAma parityAgam karomi
metadata.text_fr: Mais en revanche, si, en six mois, je n’éduque pas vos fils dans l’art du Niti-Shastra, alors je ne serai plus digne de porter mon nom !
metadata.text_en: If I do not make your sons acquainted with the etiquette in six months, I will give up my own name.
metadata.ryder: But if I do not, in six months' time, make the boys acquainted with the art of intelligent living, I will give up my own name.

metadata.ptext: kim bahunA
metadata.text_fr: Pour être bref,
metadata.ryder: Let us cut the matter short.

metadata.ptext: SrUyatAm mama eza siMha nAdaH
metadata.text_fr: écoutez donc ma parole de lion :
metadata.ryder: Listen to my lion-roar.

metadata.ptext: na aham arTa lipsuH bravImi na ca me aSIti varzasya vi A vftta sarva indriya arTasya kiYcit arTena prayojanam
metadata.text_fr: « Je n’ai aucune pensée cupide de richesses.
metadata.ryder: My boasting arises from no greed for cash.

metadata.text_fr: J’ai quatre-vingts ans et je suis débarrassé des tourments des plaisirs des sens. Je n’ai pas besoin d’une once de richesse.
metadata.ryder: Besides, I have no use for money; I am eighty years old, and all the objects of sensual desire have lost their charm.

metadata.ptext: kim tu tvad prArTanA sidDi arTam sarasvatI vinodam karizyAmi
metadata.text_fr: Mais afin de satisfaire à votre requête, je diffuserai des connaissances par jeu, en hommage à Sarasvatî, déesse de la sagesse.
metadata.ryder: But in order that your request may be granted, I will show a sporting spirit in reference to artistic matters.

metadata.ptext: tat liKyatAm adyatanaH divasaH
metadata.wtext: तल्लिख्यतामद्यतनो दिवसः यद्यहं षड्मासाभ्यन्तरे तव पुत्रान्नयशास्त्रं प्रत्यनन्यसदृशान्न करिष्यामि ततो नार्हति देवो देवमार्गसंदर्शयितुम्।”
metadata.wtranslit: tallikhyatāmadyatano divasaḥ yadyahaṁ ṣaḍmāsābhyantare tava putrānnayaśāstraṁ pratyananyasadr̥śānna kariṣyāmi tato nārhati devo devamārgasaṁdarśayitum.”
metadata.text_fr: Écrivez !
metadata.ryder: Make a note of the date.

sentences.text: यद्यहं षड्मासाभ्यन्तरे तव पुत्रान्नयशास्त्रं प्रत्यनन्यसदृशान्न करिष्यामि ततो नार्हति देवो देवमार्गसंदर्शयितुम्।”

metadata.translit: yadyahaṁ ṣaḍmāsābhyantare tava putrānnayaśāstraṁ pratyananyasadr̥śānna kariṣyāmi tato nārhati devo devamārgasaṁdarśayitum.”
metadata.ptext: yat aham zaw mAsa aByantare tava putrAn nIti SAstram pratI an anu a sadfSAn na karomi tataH arhati me devaH deva mArgam sam darSayitum iti
metadata.text_fr: « Si, en l’espace de six mois, je ne réussis pas à rendre vos fils exceptionnels dans l’art de la gouvernance, et à leur apprendre le traité de Naya-Shastra, alors je ne mériterai ni la grâce de Dieu ni ne serai digne de montrer la voie sacrée qui mène vers Lui ! »
metadata.text_en: If within an interval of six month I will not make your sons similar to no one in Nayashastra, the king won't be required to show me the way of the gods.
metadata.ryder: If I fail to render your sons, in six months' time, incomparable masters of the art of intelligent living, then His Majesty is at liberty to show me His Majestic bare bottom."

sentences.text: अथासौ राजा तां ब्राह्मणस्याऽसंभाव्यां प्रतिज्ञां श्रुत्वा ससचिवः प्रहृष्टो विस्मयान्वितस्तस्मै सादरं तान् कुमारान् समर्प्य परां निर्वृतिमजगाम।

metadata.translit: athāsau rājā tāṁ brāhmaṇasyā’saṁbhāvyāṁ pratijñāṁ śrutvā sasacivaḥ prahr̥ṣṭo vismayānvitastasmai sādaraṁ tān kumārān samarpya parāṁ nirvr̥timajagāma.
metadata.wtext: अथासौ राजा तां ब्राह्मणस्यासम्भाव्यां प्रतिज्ञां श्रुत्वा ससचिवः प्रहृष्टो विस्मन्वितस्तस्मै सादरं तान् कुमारान् समर्प्य परां निर्व्यतिम् आजगाम।
metadata.wtranslit: athāsau rājā tāṁ brāhmaṇasyāsambhāvyāṁ pratijñāṁ śrutvā sasacivaḥ prahr̥ṣṭo vismanvitastasmai sādaraṁ tān kumārān samarpya parāṁ nirvyatim ājagāma.
metadata.ptext: etAm brAhmaRasya a sam BAvyAm pratijYAm SrutvA sa sacivaH rAjA vismaya anu itaH tasmE kumArAn sam arpay parAm nirvftim jagAma
metadata.text_fr: Alors ce roi, après avoir entendu la promesse impossible du brâhmane, heureux, entouré de tous ses ministres, émerveillé, lui confia les princes avec un profond respect et fut submergé de bonheur.
metadata.ryder: When the king, surrounded by his counselors, had listened to the Brahman's highly unconventional promise, he was penetrated with wonder, intrusted the princes to him, and experienced supreme content.

sentences.text: विष्णुशर्मणापि तान् आदाय तदर्थं मित्रभॆदमित्रप्राप्तिकाकोलूकीयलब्धप्रणाशापरीक्षितकारकाणि चेति पञ्चतन्त्राणि रचयित्वा पाठिताः ते राजपुत्राः।

metadata.translit: viṣṇuśarmaṇāpi tān ādāya tadarthaṁ mitrabhèdamitraprāptikākolūkīyalabdhapraṇāśāparīkṣitakārakāṇi ceti pañcatantrāṇi racayitvā pāṭhitāḥ te rājaputrāḥ.
metadata.ptext: vizRu SarmA api tAn A dAya sva gfham gatvA tat arTam mitra BedaH mitra sam pra AptiH kAkolUkIyam labDa pra RASam a pari Ikzita kArakam iti paYca tantrARi racayitvA pAWitAH te rAja putrAH
metadata.text_fr: Les accueillant, Vishnu Sharma créa pour les princes le Pañcatantra, Les cinq livres et leur inculqua ainsi l’enseignement : mitra-bheda (La désunion des amis), mitra-prāpti (L’art de se faire des amis), kākolūkīya (La guerre des corbeaux et des hiboux), labdha-pranāśana (La perte du bien acquis) et aparīkṣita-kāritva (La conduite inconsidérée).
metadata.ryder: Meanwhile, Vishnusharman took the boys, went home, and made them learn by heart five books which he composed and called: (I) "The Loss of Friends," (II) "The Winning of Friends," (III) "Crows and Owls," (IV) "Loss of Gains," (V) "Ill-considered Action."

sentences.text: ते अपि तानि अधीत्य मासषट्केन यथा उक्तह् संवृत्ताः।

metadata.translit: te api tāni adhītya māsaṣaṭkena yathā uktah saṁvr̥ttāḥ.
metadata.wtext: तेपि तानधीत्य मासषट्केन यथोक्ताः संवृत्ताः।
metadata.wtranslit: tepi tānadhītya māsaṣaṭkena yathoktāḥ saṁvr̥ttāḥ.
metadata.text_fr: Par leur étude, en l’espace de six mois, les princes devinrent des êtres accomplis tel que cela avait été annoncé.
metadata.ryder: These the princes learned, and in six months' time they answered the prescription.

sentences.text: ततः प्रभृती एतत् पञ्चतन्त्रकम् नाम नीतिशास्त्रं बालावबोधनार्थम् भूतले प्रवृत्तम्।

metadata.translit: tataḥ prabhr̥tī etat pañcatantrakam nāma nītiśāstraṁ bālāvabodhanārtham bhūtale pravr̥ttam.
metadata.wtext: ततः प्रभृत्येतत् पञ्चतन्त्रं नाम नीतिशास्त्रं बालबोधनार्थं भूतले प्रवृत्तम्।
metadata.wtranslit: tataḥ prabhr̥tyetat pañcatantraṁ nāma nītiśāstraṁ bālabodhanārthaṁ bhūtale pravr̥ttam.
metadata.text_fr: Depuis ce temps-là, vulgarisé pour tous les enfants sur terre, le savant traité de Niti-Shastra est connu sous le nom de Pañcatantra.
metadata.ryder: Since that day this work on the art of intelligent living, called Panchatantra, or the "Five Books," has traveled the world, aiming at the awakening of intelligence in the young.

metadata.ptext: kim bahunA
metadata.text_fr: Pour être bref,
metadata.ryder: To sum the matter up:

sentences.text: अधीते य इदम् नित्यम् नीतिशस्त्रम् शृणोति च।

metadata.translit: adhīte ya idam nityam nītiśastram śr̥ṇoti ca.
metadata.wtext: अधीते य इदं नित्यं नीतिशास्त्रं श्रुणोति च।
metadata.wtranslit: adhīte ya idaṁ nityaṁ nītiśāstraṁ śruṇoti ca.
metadata.text_fr: Celui qui l’apprend par cœur, ou l’apprend par la bouche d’un conteur
metadata.ryder: Whoever learns the work by heart, / Or through the story-teller's art

sentences.text: सः न पराभवम् आप्नोति स शक्रात् अपि कर्हिचित्॥

metadata.translit: saḥ na parābhavam āpnoti sa śakrāt api karhicit :
metadata.wtext: न पराभवमवाप्नोति शक्रादपि कदाचन ॥
metadata.wtranslit: na parābhavamavāpnoti śakrādapi kadācana :
metadata.text_fr: Ne verra pas de défaite, même si son ennemi n’est autre que le roi du ciel, Indra, le tout puissant !
metadata.ryder: Becomes acquainted, / His life by sad defeat—although / The king of heaven be his foe— / Is never tainted.

metadata.ptext: kaTA muKam etat
metadata.text_fr: Ainsi va le prologue.

sentences.text: अथातः प्रारभ्यते मित्रभेदो नाम प्रथमम् तन्त्र।

metadata.translit: athātaḥ prārabhyate mitrabhedo nāma prathamam tantra.
metadata.ryder: Here then begins Book I, called "The Loss of Friends."
The first verse runs:

sentences.text: वर्धमानो महान् स्नेहः सिंहगोवृषयोर्वने । जम्बुकेनातिलुब्धेन पिशुनेन विनाशितः॥

metadata.translit: vardhamāno mahān snehaḥ siṁhagovr̥ṣayorvane . jambukenātilubdhena piśunena vināśitaḥ:
metadata.wtext: वर्धमानो महान् स्नेहः सिंहगोवृषयोर्वने । पिशुनेनातिलुब्धेन जम्बुकेन विनाशितः॥१.१॥
metadata.wtranslit: vardhamāno mahān snehaḥ siṁhagovr̥ṣayorvane . piśunenātilubdhena jambukena vināśitaḥ:1.1:
metadata.ryder: The forest lion and the bull / Were linked in friendship, growing, full: / A jackal then estranged the friends / For greedy and malicious ends.
And this is how it happened.

sentences.text: अस्ति दक्षिणात्ये जनपदे महिलारोप्यं नाम नगरम्।

metadata.translit: asti dakṣiṇātye janapade mahilāropyaṁ nāma nagaram.
metadata.ptext: dAkziRAtyezu jana padezu
metadata.ptext1: purandarapurasya fdDi sarva guRa sam pannam pfTivyAH cUqA maRi ratna BUtam
metadata.ptext2: kElAsa SiKara Akfti viviDa yantra praharaRa AcaraRa pari pUrRa go pura awwAlakam visaNkawa utkawa
metadata.ptext3: dfQa pariGa kapAwa toraRa argala upagata indra kIla vipula dvAram su vi hita SfNgAwaka catuzpaTa
metadata.ptext4: prati sTita an eka devatA Ayatanam pariKA pari karita ut Srita hima giri sadfSa AkAra prAkAra valaya pari vezwitam
metadata.ryder: In the southern country was a city called Maidens' Delight.
metadata.ryder_extra: Its contour was like that of Kailasa Peak. Its gates and palaces were stocked with machines, missile weapons, and chariots in great variety. Its central portal, massive as Indrakila Mountain, was fitted with bolt and bar, panel and arch, all formidable, impressive, solid. Its numerous temples lifted their firm bulk near spacious squares and crossings. It wore a moat-girdled zone of walls that recalled the high-uplifted Himalayas.

metadata.ptext: purandarapurasya fdDi sarva guRa sam pannam pfTivyAH cUqA maRi ratna BUtam
metadata.ryder: It rivaled the city of heaven's King, so abounding in every urban excellence as to form the central jewel of Earth's diadem.

sentences.text: तत्र बभूवुः धर्मोपार्जितभूरिविभवो वर्ध्दमान नाम वणिक्पुत्रः।

metadata.translit: tatra babhūvuḥ dharmopārjitabhūrivibhavo vardhdamāna nāma vaṇikputraḥ.
metadata.wtext: तत्र धर्मोपार्जितभूरिविभवो वर्धमानको नाम वणिक्पुत्रो बभूव।
metadata.wtranslit: tatra dharmopārjitabhūrivibhavo vardhamānako nāma vaṇikputro babhūva.
metadata.ptext: tatra an eka guRa samUhaH janma antara Darma up A arjan ava Apta Dana samUhaH varDa mAna nAmA sArTa vAhaH prati vasati sma
metadata.ryder: In this city lived a merchant named Increase. He possessed a heap of numerous virtues, and a heap of money, a result of the accumulation of merit in earlier lives.

metadata.wtext: तस्य कदाचिद् रात्रौ शय्यारूढस्य चिन्ता समुत्पन्ना।
metadata.wtranslit: tasya kadācid rātrau śayyārūḍhasya cintā samutpannā.
metadata.ptext: aTa kadAcit cintayataH arDa rAtra velAyAm IdfSam tasya cittam aBUt yaTA
metadata.ryder: As he once pondered in the dead of night, his conclusions took this form:

metadata.ptext: praBUtaH UtaH api sam citaH arTaH pra vecyamAnaH aYjanam iva kzIyate
metadata.ryder: "Even an abundant store of wealth, if pecked at, sinks together like a pile of soot.

metadata.ptext: svalpaH api sam cIyamAnaH valmIkavat varDate
metadata.ryder: A very little, if added to, grows like an ant-hill.

sentences.text: अतः प्रभूना द्रव्येण तस्य एव वृद्धिः करणीया।

metadata.translit: ataḥ prabhūnā dravyeṇa tasya eva vr̥ddhiḥ karaṇīyā.
metadata.ptext: ataH praBUnA api dravyeRa tasya eva vfdDiH karaRIyA
metadata.ryder: Hence, even though money be abundant, it should be increased.

sentences.text: अलब्धाः अर्थाः लभ्याः लब्धाः परि रक्षणीयाः रक्षिताः विवर्धनीयाः पात्रे सम्पादनीयाः चेति।

metadata.translit: alabdhāḥ arthāḥ labhyāḥ labdhāḥ pari rakṣaṇīyāḥ rakṣitāḥ vivardhanīyāḥ pātre sampādanīyāḥ ceti.
metadata.ptext: a labDAH arTAH laByAH labDAH pari rakzaRIyAH rakzitAH vi varDanIyAH pAtre sam pAdanIyAH ca iti
metadata.ryder: Riches unearned should be earned. What is earned, should be guarded. What is guarded, should be enlarged and heedfully invested.

sentences.text: लोकमार्गेण अपि रक्ष्यमाणः अर्थः बहु अप द्रवतया सद्यस् विनश्येत्।

metadata.translit: lokamārgeṇa api rakṣyamāṇaḥ arthaḥ bahu apa dravatayā sadyas vinaśyet.
metadata.ptext: loka mArgeRa api rakzyamARaH arTaH bahu apa dravatayA sadyaH vi naSyet
metadata.ryder: Money, even if hoarded in commonplace fashion, is likely to go in a flash, the hindrances being many.

sentences.text: अप्रयुज्यमानः प्रयोजनः उत्पत्तिः तुल्यः अप्राप्तस्य इति।

metadata.translit: aprayujyamānaḥ prayojanaḥ utpattiḥ tulyaḥ aprāptasya iti.
metadata.ptext: a pra yujyamAnaH prayojana utpatt tulyaH a pra Aptasya iti
metadata.ryder: Money unemployed when opportunities arise, is the same as money unpossessed.

sentences.text: ततः प्राप्तस्य सतः रक्षणे विवर्धने उपयोगे आदि कार्यम्।

metadata.translit: tataḥ prāptasya sataḥ rakṣaṇe vivardhane upayoge ādi kāryam.
metadata.ptext: tataH pra Aptasya sataH rakzaRa vi varDana upayoga Adi kAryam
metadata.ryder: Therefore, money once acquired should be guarded, increased, employed.

metadata.ptext: uktam ca
metadata.ryder: As the proverb says:

metadata.text_en: It is not known what doesn't reuse things.

metadata.wtext: यत्नेन मतिमांस्तस्मादर्थमेकं प्रसाधयेत् ॥ १.२॥
metadata.wtranslit: yatnena matimāṁstasmādarthamekaṁ prasādhayet : 1.2:
metadata.text_en: An intelligent makes the effort to reuse one of those things.

metadata.wtext: यस्यार्थास्तस्य मित्राणि यस्यार्थास्तस्य बान्धवाः।
metadata.wtranslit: yasyārthāstasya mitrāṇi yasyārthāstasya bāndhavāḥ.
metadata.text_en: He who has wealth has friends, he who has wealth has family.

sentences.text: यस्यार्थाः स पुमान् लोके यस्यार्थाः स च पण्डितः॥

metadata.translit: yasyārthāḥ sa pumān loke yasyārthāḥ sa ca paṇḍitaḥ:
metadata.wtext: यस्यार्थाः स पुमान्लोके यस्यार्थाः स च पण्डितः॥ १.३॥
metadata.wtranslit: yasyārthāḥ sa pumānloke yasyārthāḥ sa ca paṇḍitaḥ: 1.3:
metadata.text_en: He who has wealth is a man of the world, he who has wealth is a wise man.

sentences.text: स अर्थः पुरुषाणाम् षड्भिरुपायैर्भवति भिक्षया नृपसेवया कृषिकर्मणा विद्योपार्जनेन व्यवहारेण वणिक्कर्मणा वा।

metadata.translit: sa arthaḥ puruṣāṇām ṣaḍbhirupāyairbhavati bhikṣayā nr̥pasevayā kr̥ṣikarmaṇā vidyopārjanena vyavahāreṇa vaṇikkarmaṇā vā.
metadata.wtext: स चार्थः पुरुषाणां षड्भिरुपायैर्भवति भिक्षया नृपसेवया कृषिकर्मणा विद्योपार्जनेन व्यवहारेण वणिक्कर्मणा वा।
metadata.wtranslit: sa cārthaḥ puruṣāṇāṁ ṣaḍbhirupāyairbhavati bhikṣayā nr̥pasevayā kr̥ṣikarmaṇā vidyopārjanena vyavahāreṇa vaṇikkarmaṇā vā.
metadata.text_en: There are six ways of becoming a rich man: charity, service at the court, farming, science, trade or commerce.

metadata.wtext: सर्वेषाम् अपि तेषां वाणिज्येनातिरस्कृतोऽर्थलाभः स्यात्।
metadata.wtranslit: sarveṣām api teṣāṁ vāṇijyenātiraskr̥to’rthalābhaḥ syāt.
metadata.text_en: From all those, real wealth is only acquired through commerce.

metadata.wtext: तच् च वाणिज्यं सप्तविधम् अर्थागमाय स्यात्।
metadata.wtranslit: tac ca vāṇijyaṁ saptavidham arthāgamāya syāt.
metadata.text_en: The commerce can multiply the wealth seven times.

sentences.text: तद् यथा गांधिकव्यवहारः, निक्षेपप्रवेशः, गोष्ठिककर्मपरिचितग्राहकागमः, मिथ्याक्रयकथनम्, कूटतुलामानम्, देशांतराद् भांडानयनं चेति।

metadata.translit: tad yathā gāṁdhikavyavahāraḥ, nikṣepapraveśaḥ, goṣṭhikakarmaparicitagrāhakāgamaḥ, mithyākrayakathanam, kūṭatulāmānam, deśāṁtarād bhāṁḍānayanaṁ ceti.

metadata.text_en: And it is said:

sentences.text: दैववशात् उपपन्ने सति विभवे यस्य न अस्ति भोगः इच्छा न च परलोके समीहे स भवति धनपालकः मूर्खः।

metadata.translit: daivavaśāt upapanne sati vibhave yasya na asti bhogaḥ icchā na ca paraloke samīhe sa bhavati dhanapālakaḥ mūrkhaḥ.
metadata.ptext: dEva vaSAt upa panne sati viBave yasya na asti Boga icCAH na ca para loka sam IhA sa Bavati Dana pAlakaH mUrKaH
metadata.ryder: If any fail to use his fate / For joy in this or future state, / His riches serve as foolish fetters; / He simply keeps them for his betters."

sentences.text: एवम् मथुरागामीनि भाण्डान्यादाय शुभायाम् तिथौ गुरुजनानुज्ञातः सुरथाधिरूढः प्रस्थितः।

metadata.translit: evam mathurāgāmīni bhāṇḍānyādāya śubhāyām tithau gurujanānujñātaḥ surathādhirūḍhaḥ prasthitaḥ.
metadata.wtext: इत्य् एवं संप्रधार्य मथुरागामीनि भांडानि आदाय शुभायां तिथौ गुरुजनानुज्ञातः सुरथाधिरूढः प्रस्थितः।
metadata.wtranslit: ity evaṁ saṁpradhārya mathurāgāmīni bhāṁḍāni ādāya śubhāyāṁ tithau gurujanānujñātaḥ surathādhirūḍhaḥ prasthitaḥ.
metadata.ptext: evam sam pra DArya maTurA gAmIni sAra BARqAni sam A hftya sa pari janaH SuBe nakzatre SuBAyAm tiTO guru jana anu jYAtaH sva janEH anu vrajyamAnaH SaNKa tUrya nirGozeRa agrataH kriyamARena nagarAt niH sftaH
metadata.ryder: Having thus set his mind in order, he collected merchandise bound for the city of Mathura, assembled his servants, and after saying farewell to his parents when asterism and lunar station were auspicious, set forth from the city, with his people following and with blare of conch-shell and beat of drum preceding.

sentences.text: तस्य मङ्गलवृषभौ सञ्जीवकनन्दकनामानौ गृहोत्पन्नौ धूर्वोढारौ स्थितौ।

metadata.ptext(67): udaka antAt suhft janam ni vartya tasmAt aBi pra sTitaH
metadata.text(67): उदक अन्तात् सुहृत् जनम् नि वर्त्य तस्मात् अभि प्र स्थितः
metadata.translit(67): udaka antāt suhr̥t janam ni vartya tasmāt abhi pra sthitaḥ
metadata.ryder(67): At the first water he bade his friends turn back, while he proceeded.
metadata.ptext(69): aTa Dava Kadira palASa SAlEH manaH harAm anyEH ca izwa darSanEH SAKiBiH nirantara upa citAm an eka gaja gavaya mahiza ruru camarI varAha SArdula citraka fkza BayodBawAm a cala nitamba nir gata udaka pari pUritAm viviDa darI gahanAm awavIm A sAdya dUra A pAti nirJaraka ut pAdita kardamam agrEka caraRa vEkalyAt ca atiBArAt aBi hataH kasmincit pradeSe kaTam api tayoH vfzaBayoh saYjIvakaH yuga BaNgam kftvA ni zasAda
metadata.ryder(69): Presently he reached a forest lovely with grisleas, acacias, dhaks, and sals, densely planted with other trees of charming aspect; fearsome with elephants, wild oxen, buffaloes, deer, grunting-cows, boars, tigers, leopards, and bears; abounding in water that issued from the flanks of mountains; rich in caves and thickets.
metadata.translit: tasya maṅgalavr̥ṣabhau sañjīvakanandakanāmānau gr̥hotpannau dhūrvoḍhārau sthitau.
metadata.wtext: तस्य च मंगलवृषभो संजीवकनंदकनामानौ गृहोत्पन्नौ धूर्वोढारौ स्थितौ।
metadata.wtranslit: tasya ca maṁgalavr̥ṣabho saṁjīvakanaṁdakanāmānau gr̥hotpannau dhūrvoḍhārau sthitau.
metadata.ptext: tasya ca dvO maNgala vfzaBO DUH voQArO nandaka saYjIvaka nAmAnO pARqura aBra sam ni kASO suvarRa kiNkiRI pari vfta uraskO tizWataH
metadata.ryder: To bear the yoke he had two bulls of good omen. Their names were Joyful and Lively; they looked like white clouds, and their chests were girded with golden bells.
metadata.text_en: His two bulls of good omen, named Sanjivaka and Nandaka, taken from his home, bore the yoke.

sentences.text: तयोरएकः संजीवकाभिधानो यमुनाकच्छम् अवतीर्णः संपंकपूरम् आसाद्य कलितचरणो युगभंगं विधाय निषसाद।

metadata.translit: tayorekaḥ saṁjīvakābhidhāno yamunākaccham avatīrṇaḥ saṁpaṁkapūram āsādya kalitacaraṇo yugabhaṁgaṁ vidhāya niṣasāda.
metadata.text_en: The one called Sanjivaka, when descending to the muddy bank of Yamuna, got stuck, broke the leg of the yoke and lay down.
metadata.ptext: (70) tataH tam ni patitam dfzwvA SAkawikaH sa samBramaH SakawAt ut tIrya tvarita gatiH an ati dUre sa upa cAram aYjalim kftvA sArTa vAham uvAca (71) Arya putra aDva pari SrAntaH saYjIvakaH puNke ni zasAda
metadata.ryder: Here the bull Lively was overcome, partly by the excessive weight of the wagon, partly because one foot sank helpless where far-flung water from cascades made a muddy spot. At this spot the bull somehow snapped the yoke and sank in a heap.

metadata.wtext: अथ तं तद्अवस्थम् आलोक्य वर्धमानः परं विषादम् आगमत्।
metadata.wtranslit: atha taṁ tadavastham ālokya vardhamānaḥ paraṁ viṣādam āgamat.
metadata.text_en: When Vardhamana saw what happened, he was deeply dejected.
metadata.ptext: tat SrutvA varDa mAna sArTa vAhaH param vizAdam agamat
metadata.ryder: When the driver saw that he was down, he jumped excitedly from the wagon, ran to the merchant not far away, and humbly bowing, said: "Oh, my lord! Lively was wearied by the trip, and sank in the mud." On hearing this, merchant Increase was deeply dejected.

metadata.wtext: तद् अर्थं च स्नेहार्द्रहृदयस् त्रिरात्रं प्रयाणभंगम् अकरोत्।
metadata.wtranslit: tad arthaṁ ca snehārdrahr̥dayas trirātraṁ prayāṇabhaṁgam akarot.
metadata.text_en: That's why he postponed departure by three nights, with the chest in the mud.
metadata.text_en2: That's why the one with heart warm with tenderness refused to depart by three nights (possessive compound).
metadata.ptext: paYca rAtrikam a prayARakam kftvA yadA asO na kalyatAm laBate tadA tasya yavasa sama itAn rakzA puruzAn dattvA aBi hitavAn yaTA
metadata.ryder: He halted for five nights, but when the poor bull did not return to health, he left caretakers with a supply of fodder, and said:

metadata.wtext: अथ तं विषण्णम् आलोक्य सार्थिकैर् अभिहितम् भोः श्रेष्ठिन्! किम् एवं वृषभस्य कृते सिंहव्याघ्रसमाकुले बह्वपायेस्मिन् वने समस्तसार्थस् त्वया संदेहे नियोजितः।
metadata.wtranslit: atha taṁ viṣaṇṇam ālokya sārthikair abhihitam bhoḥ śreṣṭhin! kim evaṁ vr̥ṣabhasya kr̥te siṁhavyāghrasamākule bahvapāyesmin vane samastasārthas tvayā saṁdehe niyojitaḥ.
metadata.text_en: Thus after having looked at the sad man his companions said:

sentences.text: अथ तदवधार्य सञ्जीवकस्य रक्षापुरुषान् निरूप्या शेषसार्थम् स प्रस्थितः।

metadata.wtext: अथासौ तद् अवधार्य संजीवकस्य रक्षापुरुषान् निरूप्याशेषसार्थं नीत्वा प्रस्थितः।
metadata.wtranslit: athāsau tad avadhārya saṁjīvakasya rakṣāpuruṣān nirūpyāśeṣasārthaṁ nītvā prasthitaḥ.
metadata.ptext(74): ayam saYjIvakaH yadi jIvati tadA enam gfhItvA yadi mriyate tadA amum sam kftya yuzmABiH A gantavyam
metadata.ryder: Having given these directions, he started for his destination.
metadata.translit: atha tadavadhārya sañjīvakasya rakṣāpuruṣān nirūpyā śeṣasārtham sa prasthitaḥ.
metadata.text_en: He pondered it, then waved at Sanjivaka's caretakers and left with the rest of the caravan.
metadata.ptext: evam A diSya yaTA aBi lazitam deSa antaram pra sTitaH

sentences.text: अस्माभिः तु सार्थवाहस्य अभीष्ट इति मत्वा वह्निना संस्कृतः।

metadata.wtext: अस्माभिस् तु सार्थवाहस्याभीष्ट इति मत्वा वह्निना संस्कृतः इति।
metadata.wtranslit: asmābhis tu sārthavāhasyābhīṣṭa iti matvā vahninā saṁskr̥taḥ iti.
metadata.ptext(76): anye dyuH ca bahu apAyam vanam iti BayAt tEH api gatvA svAmine mfzA ni veditam yaTA
metadata.ryder(76): On the next day, the men, fearing the many drawbacks of the forest, started also and made a false report to their master.
metadata.translit: asmābhiḥ tu sārthavāhasya abhīṣṭa iti matvā vahninā saṁskr̥taḥ.
metadata.text_en: However, we have decided to perform the last sad rites with the animal.
metadata.ptext: mftaH asO saYjIvakaH asmABiH ca agni AdinA saMskAreRa sam kftaH iti
metadata.ryder: "Poor Lively died," they said, "and we performed the last sad rites with fire and everything else."

sentences.text: अथ कदाचित् पिङ्गलकः नाम सिंहः सर्वमृगपरिवृतः पिपासाकुल उदकपानार्थम् यमुनातटमवतीर्णः

metadata.wtext: अथ कदाचित् पिंगलको नाम सिंहः सर्वमृगपरिवृतः पिपासाकुल उदकपानार्थं यमुनातटम् अवतीर्णः संजीवकस्य गंभीरतररावं दूराद् एवाशृणोत्।
metadata.wtranslit: atha kadācit piṁgalako nāma siṁhaḥ sarvamr̥gaparivr̥taḥ pipāsākula udakapānārthaṁ yamunātaṭam avatīrṇaḥ saṁjīvakasya gaṁbhīratararāvaṁ dūrād evāśr̥ṇot.
metadata.ptext(78): tat ca SrutvA sArTa vAhaH kzaRa mAtram duHKam kftvA kftajYatayA ca pra ita kfti Adi kriyAm kftvA maTurAm a viGnena sam pra AptaH
metadata.ryder(78): And the merchant, feeling grieved for a mere moment, out of gratitude performed a ceremony that included rites for the departed, then journeyed without hindrance to Mathura.
metadata.ptext(79): aTa saYjIvakaH sva BAgyAnAm vaSAt AyuH SezatayA ca nirJara udaka kaRa prakArEH A SvAsita SarIraH SanEH SanEH yamunA kacCam ava tIrRaH
metadata.ryder(79): In the meantime, Lively, since his fate willed it and further life was predestined, hobbled step by step to the bank of the Jumna, his body invigorated by a mist of spray from the cascades.
metadata.ptext(80): tasmin ca marakata sadfSAni Sazpa pallava agrARi Bakzayan katipayEH ahoBiH hara vfzaBaH iva pInaH kakudmAn balavAn ca sam vfttaH
metadata.ryder(80): There he browsed on the emerald tips of grass-blades, and in a few days grew plump as Shiva's bull, high-humped, and full of energy.
metadata.ptext(81): prati aham valmIka SiKarARi SfNga agra GawwanEH ut liKan dantivat tizWati
metadata.ryder(81): Every day he tore the tops of ant-hills with goring horns, and frisked like an elephant.
metadata.translit: atha kadācit piṅgalakaḥ nāma siṁhaḥ sarvamr̥gaparivr̥taḥ pipāsākula udakapānārtham yamunātaṭamavatīrṇaḥ
metadata.text_en: But once a lion named Pingalaka, surrounded by animals and thirsty, came down to the bank of Yamuna for water.
metadata.ptext: aTa kadAcit sarva mfga pari vftaH piNgalakaH nAma siMhaH udaka grahaRa arTam yamunA kacCam ava tIrRaH
metadata.ryder: But one day a lion named Rusty, with a retinue of all kinds of animals, came down to the bank of the Jumna for water.

metadata.ptext: sa ca saYjIvakasya mahAntam garjita Sabdam aSfRot tam ca SrutvA atIva kzuBita hfdayaH svakIyam AkAram pra CAdya maRqala vawasya aDastAt catur maRqala avasTAnena ava sTitaH
metadata.ryder: There he heard Lively's prodigious bellow. The sound troubled his heart exceedingly, but he concealed his inner feelings while beneath a spreading banyan tree he drew up his company in what is called the Circle of Four.

metadata.wtext: तौ च परस्परं मंत्रयतः।
metadata.wtranslit: tau ca parasparaṁ maṁtrayataḥ.
metadata.ptext(84): Aha ca catuH maRqala avasTAna nAmAni
metadata.ryder(84): Now the divisions of the Circle of Four are given as:
metadata.ptext(85): siMhaH siMha anu yAyI kAkara vargaH kim vfttaH ca iti maRqalAni
metadata.ryder(85): (1) the lion, (2) the lion's guard, (3) the understrappers, (4) the menials.
metadata.ptext(86): tatra sarvezu eva nagara pattana aDi saTAna Kewaka vawa bARa agra hAra kAnana vana sTAnezu ekaH eva siMha sTAnIyaH Bavati
metadata.ryder(86): In all cities, capitals, towns, hamlets, market-centers, settlements, border-posts, land-grants, monasteries, and communities there is just one occupant of the lion's post.
metadata.ptext(87): katipayAH siMha anu yAyinaH tatra carAH
metadata.ryder(87): Relatively few are active as the lion's guard.
metadata.ryder(88): The understrappers are the indiscriminate throng.
metadata.ptext(89): kim vfttAH vana anta sTAna vAsinaH
metadata.ryder(89): The menials are posted on the outskirts.
metadata.ryder(90): The three classes are each divided into members high, middle, and low.
metadata.ptext(91): aTa piNgalakaH sa amAtyaH sa suhft janaH Cattra cAmara vyajana vAhana vilAsa vistAra vi rahitam a kftrima sAhasa rasa eka anta darpa ut hatam aBagramAna mada utsekam a sahamAnatayA svayam grAha nir aNkuSa darSita ESvaryam an aBijYam itara jana sevitAnAm kfpaRa vacasAm amarza roza saMramBa garva prasTAnam a kAtaratva puruzArTam anu kzipta aYjali puwam a dInam a BItam a kfta cAwu karma upAyam vyavasAya pOruza aBimAna ava stamBa BAsuram an anya sevi niHsaNgam an AtmamBari paropakAra suKa vi akta puruza kAra Palam a pari BUtam a kfSam a tucCam apa gata durga prati samskAra cittam a gaRita aya vyayam a vilomam an A yattam ut hata upa arjita arjita pratApa vizamam azAqruRya sampraDAraRam a praharaRa ABaraRam a sADAraRa viBava grAsam a parokza vfttam an A SaNkanIyam an apekzita kalatra parzRi grAha asAra Akrandam a nindyam a Gawita a Sikzita astf ara yogam an icCa viGAti parijana nirapekza labDa grAsa nivAsa sOhityam vana Antare niHSaNkam niHsADvasam uccEH SiraH rAjatvam anu baBUva
metadata.ryder(91): Now Rusty, with counselors and intimates, enjoyed a kingship of the following order. His royal office, though lacking the pomp of umbrella, flyflap, fan, vehicle, and amorous display, was held erect by sheer pride in the sentiment of unaffected pluck. It showed unbroken haughtiness and abounding self-esteem. It manifested a native zeal for unchecked power that brooked no rival. It was ignorant of cringing speech, which it delegated to those who like that sort of thing. It functioned by means of impatience, wrath, haste, and hauteur. Its manly goal was fearlessness, disdaining fawning, strange to obsequiousness, unalarmed. It made use of no wheedling artifices, but glittered in its reliance on enterprise, valor, dignity. It was independent, unattached, free from selfish worry. It advertised the reward of manliness by its pleasure in benefiting others. It was unconquered, free from constraint and meanness, while it had no thought of elaborating defensive works. It kept no account of revenue and expenditure. It knew no deviousness nor time-serving, but was prickly with the energy earned by loftiness of spirit. It wasted no deliberation on the conventional six expedients, nor did it hoard weapons or jewelry. It had an uncommon appetite for power, never adopted subterfuges, was never an object of suspicion. It paid no heed to wives or ambush-layers, to their torrents of tears or their squeals. It was without reproach. It had no artificial training in the use of weapons, but it did not disappoint expectations. It found satisfactory food and shelter without dependence on servants. It had no timidity about any foreign forest, and no alarms. Its head was high.
metadata.ptext(93): ekAkini vanavAsinI a rAja lakzmaRI a nIti SAstra jYe sattva utkawe mfga patO rAjA iti giraH pari namanti
metadata.ryder(93): The lion needs, in forest station, // No trappings and no education, // But lonely power and pride; // And all the song his subjects sing, // Is in the words: "O King! O King!" // No epithet beside.
metadata.ptext(95): na aBizekaH na saMskAraH siMhasya kriyate mfgEH vikrama arjita vittasya svayam eva mfgendratA
metadata.ryder(95): The lion needs, for his appointing, // No ceremony, no anointing; // His deeds of heroism bring // Him fortune. Nature crowns him king.
metadata.ptext(96): sadA manda mada syandi mAtaNga piSita aSanaH a sam panna Ipsita AhArah tfRAni atti na kesarI
metadata.ryder(96): The elephant is the lion's meat, // With drops of trickling ichor sweet; // Though lack thereof should come to pass, // The lion does not nibble grass.
metadata.ptext(97): tasya ca karawaka damanaka nAmAnO AnO dvO SfgAlO Brazwa aDikArO mantri putrO AstAm
metadata.ryder(97): Now Rusty had in his train two jackals, sons of counselors, but out of a job. Their names were Cheek and Victor.
metadata.ptext: tO ca parasparam mantrayitum A rabDO
metadata.ryder: These two conferred secretly,

metadata.wtext: तत्र दमनकोऽब्रवीत्
metadata.wtranslit: tatra damanako’bravīt
metadata.text_en: Then Damanaka said:
metadata.ptext: tatra damanakaH abravIt
metadata.ryder: and Victor said:

sentences.text: भद्र करटक अस्मत्स्वामी पिङ्गलकः उदकग्रहणार्थम् इतः प्रवृत्तः।

metadata.translit: bhadra karaṭaka asmatsvāmī piṅgalakaḥ udakagrahaṇārtham itaḥ pravr̥ttaḥ.
metadata.wtext: भद्र करटक, अयं तावद् अस्मत्स्वामी पिंगलक उदकग्रहणार्थं यमुनाकच्छम् अवतीर्य स्थितः।
metadata.wtranslit: bhadra karaṭaka, ayaṁ tāvad asmatsvāmī piṁgalaka udakagrahaṇārthaṁ yamunākaccham avatīrya sthitaḥ.
metadata.ptext: Badra karawaka ayam tAvat asmat svAmI piNgalakaH udaka grahaRa arTam itaH pra vfttaH
metadata.ryder: "My dear Cheek, just look at our master Rusty. He came this way for water.

metadata.wtext: स किं निमित्तं पिपासाकुलोऽपि निवृत्त्य व्यूहरचनां विधाय दौर्मनस्येनाभिभूतोऽत्र वटतले स्थितः।
metadata.wtranslit: sa kiṁ nimittaṁ pipāsākulo’pi nivr̥ttya vyūharacanāṁ vidhāya daurmanasyenābhibhūto’tra vaṭatale sthitaḥ.
metadata.ptext(101): kim nimittam iha dOrmanasyena ava sTitaH
metadata.ryder(101): For what reason does he crouch here so disconsolate?"
metadata.ptext: saH abravIt
metadata.ryder: said Cheek.

sentences.text: कस्मिंश्चिन्नगराभ्यासे केनापि वणिक्पुत्रेण तरुखण्डमध्ये देवताः यतनं कर्तुम् आरब्धम्।

metadata.wtext: कस्मिंश्चिन् नगराभ्याशे केनापि वणिक्पुत्रेण तरुखंडमध्ये देवतायतनं कर्तुम् आरब्धम्।
metadata.wtranslit: kasmiṁścin nagarābhyāśe kenāpi vaṇikputreṇa tarukhaṁḍamadhye devatāyatanaṁ kartum ārabdham.
metadata.ptext(105): a vyApArezu vyApAram yaH naraH kartum icCati saH eva niDanam yAti kIlotpAwI iva vAnaraH
metadata.ryder(105): Death pursues the meddling flunkey: // Note the wedge-extracting monkey."
metadata.ryder(108): And Cheek told the story of
metadata.translit: kasmiṁścinnagarābhyāse kenāpi vaṇikputreṇa tarukhaṇḍamadhye devatāḥ yatanaṁ kartum ārabdham.
metadata.ptext: asti kasminScit pradeSe nagaram (111) tasya A sanna tara KaRqa maDye kena api vaRijA devatA yatanam kAryate sma
metadata.ryder: There was a city in a certain region. (111) In a grove near by, a merchant was having a temple built.

sentences.text: तत्र ये कर्मकराः स्थापनादयस्ते मध्याह्नवेलायामाहारार्थं नगरमध्ये गच्छन्ति।

metadata.translit: tatra ye karmakarāḥ sthāpanādayaste madhyāhnavelāyāmāhārārthaṁ nagaramadhye gacchanti.
metadata.wtext: तत्र च ये कर्मकराः स्थापनादयः। ते मध्याह्नवेलायाम् आहारार्थं नगरमध्ये गच्छंति।
metadata.wtranslit: tatra ca ye karmakarāḥ sthāpanādayaḥ. te madhyāhnavelāyām āhārārthaṁ nagaramadhye gacchaṁti.
metadata.ptext: tatra ye karma karAH sTapati AdayaH te maDya ahna velAyAm AhAra arTam pratidinam nagaram pra viSanti
metadata.ryder: Each day at the noon hour the foreman and workers would go to the city for lunch.

sentences.text: एतस्मिन्नन्तरे ते वानराः यथेच्छया क्रीडितुम् आरब्धम्।

metadata.wtext: एतस्मिंन् अन्तरे ते वानरास् तरुशिखरप्रसादशृंगदारुपर्यंतेषु यथेच्छया क्रीडितुम् आरब्धाः।
metadata.wtranslit: etasmiṁn antare te vānarās taruśikharaprasādaśr̥ṁgadāruparyaṁteṣu yathecchayā krīḍitum ārabdhāḥ.
metadata.ptext(113): aTa ekasmin dine vAnara yUTam tat arDa kfta devatA yatanam A yAtam
metadata.ryder(113): Now one day a troop of monkeys came upon the half-built temple.
metadata.ptext(114): aTa ekasya SilpinaH arDa sPawitaH mahA pramARaH aYjana stamBaH Sirasi ni KAta KAdira kIlakaH ava tizWate
metadata.ryder(114): There lay a tremendous anjana-log, which a mechanic had begun to split, a wedge of acacia-wood being thrust in at the top.
metadata.translit: etasminnantare te vānarāḥ yathecchayā krīḍitum ārabdham.
metadata.ptext: vAnarAH ca sva icCayA taru SiKara prAsAda SfNga dAru nicayezu yaTezwam krIqitum A rabDAH
metadata.ryder: There the monkeys began their playful frolics upon tree-top, lofty roof, and woodpile.

metadata.wtext: अतोऽहं ब्रवीमि अव्यापारेषु इति।
metadata.wtranslit: ato’haṁ bravīmi avyāpāreṣu iti.
metadata.ptext(116): tatra ekaH ca A sanna vinASaH cApalAt upa viSya stamBe kena ayam a sTAne kIlakaH ni KAtaH iti pARiByAm sam gfhya ut pAwayitum A rabDaH
metadata.ryder(116): Then one of them, whose doom was near, thoughtlessly bestrode the log, thinking: "Who stuck a wedge in this queer place?" So he seized it with both hands and started to work it loose.
metadata.ptext(117): arDa sPAwita antara pra vizwa vfzaRa sTAnAt calita kIlakena yat vfttam tat BavatA vyA KyAtam api viditam iti
metadata.ryder(117): Now what happened when the wedge gave at the spot where his private parts entered the cleft, that, sir, you know without being told.
metadata.ptext: ataH aham bravImi
metadata.ryder: "And that is why I say

metadata.ptext(119): a vyApAraH prAjYEH pari hartavyaH iti
metadata.ryder(119): that meddling should be avoided by the intelligent.
metadata.wtext: आवयोर् भक्षितशेष आहारोऽस्त्य् एव।
metadata.wtranslit: āvayor bhakṣitaśeṣa āhāro’sty eva.
metadata.ptext: AvayoH tAvat Bakzita Seza AhAra mAtra vartanam asti eva
metadata.ryder: "that we two pick up a fair living just from his leavings."
metadata.text-en: to us the food is the remainder of what has been eaten.

metadata.wtext: दमनक आह तत् किं भवान् आहारार्थी केवलम् एव।
metadata.wtranslit: damanaka āha tat kiṁ bhavān āhārārthī kevalam eva.
metadata.ptext: damanakaH Aha
metadata.ryder: "But," said Victor,

metadata.ptext(123): kaTam AhAra mAtra arTI kevalam BavAn praDAna sevAm kurute na viSeza arTitayA
metadata.ryder(123): "how can you give first-rate service merely from a desire for food with no desire for distinction?
metadata.wtext: तन् न युक्तम्। उक्तं च
metadata.wtranslit: tan na yuktam. uktaṁ ca
metadata.text_en: It is not appropriate.
metadata.ptext: sADu ca idam ucyate
metadata.ryder: There is wisdom in the saying:

sentences.text: सुहृदाम् उपकारम् करणात् द्विषतानम् अपि उपकारम् करणात् नृपसंश्रय इष्यन्ते बुधैः जठरं को न बिभर्ति केवलम्

metadata.translit: suhr̥dām upakāram karaṇāt dviṣatānam api upakāram karaṇāt nr̥pasaṁśraya iṣyante budhaiḥ jaṭharaṁ ko na bibharti kevalam
metadata.wtext: सुहृदाम् उपकारणाद् द्विषताम् अप्य् अपकारणात्। नृपसंश्रय इष्यते बुधैर् जठरं को न बिभर्ति केवलम्॥पञ्च_१.२२॥
metadata.wtranslit: suhr̥dām upakāraṇād dviṣatām apy apakāraṇāt. nr̥pasaṁśraya iṣyate budhair jaṭharaṁ ko na bibharti kevalam:pañca_1.22:
metadata.ptext: suhfdAm upakAra kAraRAt dvizatAm api apakAra kAraRAt nfpa saMSrayaH izyate buDEH jaWaram kaH na biBarti kevalam
metadata.ryder: In hurting foes and helping friends // The wise perceive the proper ends // Of serving kings. The belly's call // To answer, is no job at all.

sentences.text: यस्मिन् जीवति जीवन्ति बहवः सो'त्र जीवतु।

metadata.wtext: यस्मिञ् जीवंति जीवंति बहवः सोऽत्र जीवतु।
metadata.wtranslit: yasmiñ jīvaṁti jīvaṁti bahavaḥ so’tra jīvatu.
metadata.translit: yasmin jīvati jīvanti bahavaḥ so'tra jīvatu.
metadata.ptext: yasmin jIvati jIvanti bahavaH sa tu jIvati
metadata.ryder: When many lives on one depend, / Then life is life indeed:

sentences.text: वयाम्सि किम् न कुर्वन्ति चञ्च्वा स्वोदरपूरणम्॥

metadata.translit: vayāmsi kim na kurvanti cañcvā svodarapūraṇam:
metadata.wtext: वयांसि किं न कुर्वंति चञ्च्वा स्वोदरपूरणम्॥पञ्च_१.२३॥
metadata.wtranslit: vayāṁsi kiṁ na kurvaṁti cañcvā svodarapūraṇam:pañca_1.23:
metadata.text_en: Don't crows fill their bellies with their beaks?
metadata.ptext: vayAMsi kim na kurvanti caYcvA sva udara pUraRam
metadata.ryder: A crow, with beak equipped, can fill / His belly's selfish need.

sentences.text: यो न आत्मना न च परेण च बन्धुवर्गे दीने न कुरुते न च मर्त्यवर्गे।

metadata.wtext: यो नात्मना न च परेण च बंधुवर्गे दीने दयां न कुरुते न च मर्त्यवर्गे।
metadata.wtranslit: yo nātmanā na ca pareṇa ca baṁdhuvarge dīne dayāṁ na kurute na ca martyavarge.
metadata.translit: yo na ātmanā na ca pareṇa ca bandhuvarge dīne na kurute na ca martyavarge.
metadata.ptext: yaH na Atmane na gurave na ca banDu varge dIne dayAm na kurute na ca Bftya varge
metadata.ryder: If loving kindness be not shown // To friends and souls in pain, // To teachers, servants, and one's self,

metadata.wtext: किं तस्य जीवितफलं हि मनुष्यलोके काकोऽपि जीवति चिराय बलिं च भुंक्ते॥पञ्च_१.२५॥
metadata.wtranslit: kiṁ tasya jīvitaphalaṁ hi manuṣyaloke kāko’pi jīvati cirāya baliṁ ca bhuṁkte:pañca_1.25:
metadata.ptext: kim tasya jIvita Palam hi manuzya loke kAkaH api jIvati ciram balim ca BuNkte
metadata.ryder: What use in life, what gain? // A crow will live for many years // And eat the offered grain.

sentences.text: परिवर्तिनि संसारे मृतः को न जायते।

metadata.ptext(129): svalpa snAyu vasA ava Seza malinam niH mAMsam api asTikam SvA labDvA paritozam eti na ca tat tasya kzuDA SAntaye siMhaH jambukam aNkam A gatam api tyaktvA ni hanti dvipam sarvaH kfcCra gataH api vAYCati janaH sattva anu rUpam Palam
metadata.ryder(129): The lion scorns the jackal, though // Between his paws, to smite // The elephant. For everyone, // However sad his plight, // Demands the recompense that he // Esteems his native right.
metadata.ptext(130): lANgUla cAlanam aDaH caraRa avapAtam BUmO ni patya vadana udara darSanam ca SvA piRqa dasya kurute gaja puNgavaH tu DIram vi lokayati cAwu SatEH ca BuNkte
metadata.ryder(130): Dogs wag their tails and fawn and roll, // Bare mouth and belly, at your feet: // Bull-elephants show self-esteem, // Demand much coaxing ere they eat.
metadata.ptext(131): su purA vE ku nadikA su pUraH mUzaka aYjaliH su santozaH kA puruzaH svalpakena api tuzyati
metadata.ryder(131): A tiny rill // Is quick to fill, // And quick a mouse's paws; // So seedy men // Are grateful, when // There is but little cause.
metadata.wtext: परिवर्तिनि संसारे मृतः को वा न जायते। जातस् तु गण्यते सोऽत्र यः स्फुरेच् च श्रियाधिकः॥पञ्च_१.२८॥
metadata.wtranslit: parivartini saṁsāre mr̥taḥ ko vā na jāyate. jātas tu gaṇyate so’tra yaḥ sphurec ca śriyādhikaḥ:pañca_1.28:
metadata.ptext(132): a hita hita vicAra SUnya budDeH Sruti samayEH bahuBiH bahiH kftasya udara BaraRa mAtram eva lipsoH puruza paSoH ca paSoH ca kaH viSezaH
metadata.ryder(132): For if there be no mind // Debating good and ill, // And if religion send // No challenge to the will, // If only greed be there // For some material feast, // How draw a line between // The man-beast and the beast?
metadata.translit: parivartini saṁsāre mr̥taḥ ko na jāyate.
metadata.text_en: In ever-turning transition is dead who is not born.

sentences.text: जायन्ते विरला लोके जलदा इव सज्जनाः॥

metadata.wtext: जायंते विरला लोके जलदा इव सज्जनाः॥पञ्च_१.३०॥
metadata.wtranslit: jāyaṁte viralā loke jaladā iva sajjanāḥ:pañca_1.30:
metadata.translit: jāyante viralā loke jaladā iva sajjanāḥ:
metadata.text_en: Rare clouds are born in the world; they look as if they were human.

sentences.text: निरतिशयं गरिमाणं तेन जनन्याः स्मरन्ति विद्वांसः।

metadata.translit: niratiśayaṁ garimāṇaṁ tena jananyāḥ smaranti vidvāṁsaḥ.
metadata.wtext: निरतिशयं गरिमाणं तेन जनन्याः स्मरंति विद्वांसः। यत् कम् अपि वहति गर्भं महताम् अपि यो गुरुर् भवति॥पञ्च_१.३१॥
metadata.wtranslit: niratiśayaṁ garimāṇaṁ tena jananyāḥ smaraṁti vidvāṁsaḥ. yat kam api vahati garbhaṁ mahatām api yo gurur bhavati:pañca_1.31:
metadata.text_en: Scholars remember the unsurpassable weight of expectant mothers.

sentences.text: अपृष्टः अत्र अप्रधानः यः ब्रूते राज्ञः पुरः कुधीः।

metadata.wtext: अपृष्टोऽत्राप्रधानो यो ब्रूते राज्ञः पुरः कुधीः। न केवलम् असम्मानं लभते च विडंबनम्॥पञ्च_१.३३॥
metadata.wtranslit: apr̥ṣṭo’trāpradhāno yo brūte rājñaḥ puraḥ kudhīḥ. na kevalam asammānaṁ labhate ca viḍaṁbanam:pañca_1.33:
metadata.ptext(134): guru Sakawa Duram DaraH tfRa ASI sama vizamezu ca lANgala Apa karzI jagat upakaraRam pavitra yoniH nara paSunA kim u mIyate gava indraH
metadata.ryder(134): Since cattle draw the plow // Through rough and level soil, // And bend their patient necks // To heavy wagons' toil, // Are kind, of sinless birth, // And find in grass a feast, // How can they be compared // With any human beast?"
metadata.ryder(136): "But at present, we two hold no job at court.
metadata.ptext(139): Badra kiyatA api kAlena praDAnaH a praDAnaH api Bavati
metadata.ryder(139): "My dear fellow, after a little the jobless man does hold a job.
metadata.translit: apr̥ṣṭaḥ atra apradhānaḥ yaḥ brūte rājñaḥ puraḥ kudhīḥ.
metadata.text_en: Disregarded is who says that the king is stupid.
and so

sentences.text: वचः तत्र प्रयोक्तव्यं यत्र उक्तं लभते फलम्।

metadata.translit: vacaḥ tatra prayoktavyaṁ yatra uktaṁ labhate phalam.
metadata.wtext: वचस् तत्र प्रयोक्तव्यं यत्रोक्तं लभते फलम्।
metadata.wtranslit: vacas tatra prayoktavyaṁ yatroktaṁ labhate phalam.
metadata.text_en: Speech should just be used where the spoken word brings fruit.
metadata.ptext: vacaH tatra pra yoktavyam yatra uktam laBate Palam

sentences.text: स्थायी भवति अत्यन्तं रागः शुक्लपटे यथा॥

metadata.translit: sthāyī bhavati atyantaṁ rāgaḥ śuklapaṭe yathā:
metadata.wtext: स्थायी भवति चात्यन्तं रागः शुक्लपटे यथा॥पञ्च_१.३४॥
metadata.wtranslit: sthāyī bhavati cātyantaṁ rāgaḥ śuklapaṭe yathā:pañca_1.34:
metadata.text_en: How does coloration of a white cloth stay stable forever?
metadata.ptext: sTAyI Bavati ca atyantam rAgaH Sukla pawe yaTA

sentences.text: अप्रधानः प्रधानम् स्यात् सेवते यदि पार्थिवम्।

metadata.wtext: अप्रधानः प्रधानः स्यात् सेवते यदि पार्थिवम्। प्रधानोऽप्य् अप्रधानः स्याद् यदि सेवाविवर्जितः॥पञ्च_१.३५॥
metadata.wtranslit: apradhānaḥ pradhānaḥ syāt sevate yadi pārthivam. pradhāno’py apradhānaḥ syād yadi sevāvivarjitaḥ:pañca_1.35:
metadata.translit: apradhānaḥ pradhānam syāt sevate yadi pārthivam.
metadata.ptext: a praDAnaH praDAnaH syAt pArTivam yadi sevate praDAnaH api a praDAnaH syAt yadi sevA vi varjitaH
metadata.ryder: The jobless man is hired // For careful serving; // The holder may be fired, // If undeserving.

metadata.wtext: करटक आह अथ भवान् किं कर्तुमनाः?
metadata.wtranslit: karaṭaka āha atha bhavān kiṁ kartumanāḥ?
metadata.ptext(142): na kasyacit kaScit iha praBAvAt Bavati udAraH aBi mataH KalaH vA loke gurutvam viparItatAm vA sva cezwitAni eva naram nayanti
metadata.ryder(142): No character moves up or down // At others' smile or others' frown; // But honor or contempt on earth // Will follow conduct's inner worth.
metadata.ptext(144): A ropyate aSmA SEla agram yaTA yatnena BUyasA pAtyate suKam eva aDaH taTA AtmA guRa dozayoH
metadata.ryder(144): It costs an effort still // To carry stones uphill; // They tumble in a trice: // So virtue, and so vice."
metadata.ptext: karawakaH Aha
metadata.ryder: "Well," said Cheek,

metadata.ptext: aTa BavAn kim vaktu manAH
metadata.ryder: "what do you wish to imply?"

metadata.wtext: सोऽब्रवीत्
metadata.wtranslit: so’bravīt
metadata.ptext: saH abravIt
metadata.ryder: And Victor answered:

sentences.text: अयम् तावत् अस्मत्स्वामी भीतः मूढमनाः संतिष्ठते।

metadata.translit: ayam tāvat asmatsvāmī bhītaḥ mūḍhamanāḥ saṁtiṣṭhate.
metadata.wtext: अद्यास्मत्स्वामी पिंगलको भीतो भीतपरिवारश् च वर्तते।
metadata.wtranslit: adyāsmatsvāmī piṁgalako bhīto bhītaparivāraś ca vartate.
metadata.ptext: ayam tAvat asmat svAmI BItaH BIta parivAraH ca mUQa manAH sam tizWate
metadata.ryder: "You see, our master is frightened, his servants are frightened, and he does not know what to do."

metadata.wtext: करटक आह कथं वेत्ति भवान् यद् भयाविष्टोऽयं स्वामी?
metadata.wtranslit: karaṭaka āha kathaṁ vetti bhavān yad bhayāviṣṭo’yaṁ svāmī?
metadata.ptext: saH abravIt
metadata.ryder: asked Cheek,

metadata.ptext: kaTam BavAn jAnAti
metadata.ryder: "How can you be sure of that?"

metadata.wtext: सो ब्रवीत् ज्ञेयं किम् अत्र? यत उक्तं च
metadata.wtranslit: so bravīt jñeyaṁ kim atra? yata uktaṁ ca
metadata.ptext: damanakaH Aha
metadata.ryder: and Victor said:

metadata.ptext: kim atra kzAtavyam
metadata.ryder: "Isn't it plain?
metadata.text_en: what is to be known?

metadata.wtext: करटक आह
metadata.wtranslit: karaṭaka āha
metadata.ptext(153): ut IritaH arTaH paSunA api gfhyate hayAH ca nAgAH ca vahanti noditAH an uktam api Uhati paRqitaH janaH para iNgita kzAna PalAH hi budDayaH
metadata.ryder(153): But men of wisdom can infer // Unuttered thought from features' stir— // For wit rewards its worshiper.
metadata.ptext(155): AkArEH iNgitEH gatyA cezwayA BAzaRena ca netra vaktra vikariRa gfhyate antaH gatam manaH
metadata.ryder(155): From feature, gesture, gait, // From twitch, or word, // From change in eye or face // Is thought inferred.
metadata.ptext(156): tat enam adya eva Atma prakzA pra BAveRa vaSI karizyAmi
metadata.ryder(156): So by virtue of native intelligence I intend to get him into my power this very day."
metadata.ptext: karawakaH Aha
metadata.ryder: "Why," said Cheek,

metadata.wtext: अनभिज्ञो भवान् सेवाधर्मस्य।
metadata.wtranslit: anabhijño bhavān sevādharmasya.
metadata.ptext: an aBijYa BavAn kila sevA Darmasya
metadata.ryder: "you do not know how to make yourself useful to a superior.
